description: Soho is a unique neighbourhood of creativity and diversity. Join us at the former Warner Brothers De Lane Lea studio at 75 Dean Street, home of the Museum of Soho and the Westminster LGBT+ Forum. Explore an exhibition of Soho's creativity and enjoy Soho short films in our cinema.

factsheet.heading: The constantly changing faces and places of Soho
paragraphs:
Soho is an urban village, shaped and redrawn through time and the extraordinary array of creative and talented people who have made it their home or work canvass.
 
Join us at the former Warner Brother Sound Studio at 75 Dean Street, home to the Museum of Soho and the Westminster LGBT+ Forum.
 
Explore ePhemeral?: Over a century of images reflecting the changing faces and places of an urbane village, specially curated by the Museum for Open House Soho. With work from the MoSoho and Westminster Archives as well as photographic contributions from:
 
Carla Borel
John Claridge
Peter Clark
Clancy Gebler Davies
Afshin Feiz
Damien Frost
Lenny Di Lorenzo
Gerard McNamara 
Chris Shaw
Louis Siroy
Robert Stallard
Sonia Vico
 
 
Take a seat in the cinema and view rolling short films featuring Soho life past, interspersed with human library films from present day members of the local LGBT+ community.
 
Speak to one of our volunteers for suggestions as you continue to explore our extraordinary neighbourhood.

travel_info: Tube: Leicester Square, Oxford Circus, Tottenham Court Road

name: De Lane Lea Studios, 75 Dean Street
